results.name: a(n) = A001222(A048673(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ Using code of _Michel Marcus_
from sympy import factorint, nextprime, primefactors, prod
def a001222(n): return 0 if n==1 else a001222(n//primefactors(n)[-1]) + 1
return 1 if n==1 else (1 + prod(nextprime(i)**f[i] for i in f))//2
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 51)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 12 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 31 2017
